problem: A student wants to save $\$50000$ in a savings account by the end of 10 years. The account offers a compound interest rate of 5% per year. How much should the student deposit initially to meet her goal? (Give the answer in decimal and round to 2 decimal places)
solution: Let $P$ be the initial amount the student deposits. After 10 years, with a compound interest rate of 5% per year, the total amount will be $P \cdot 1.05^{10}$. To reach her goal of $50000, $P$ must satisfy \[P = \frac{50000}{1.05^{10}} = \boxed{30695.66},\] rounded to the nearest dollar.
